title: Launching tutorial.js
text:
To initialize tutorial.js, add this HTML code where you want to place the tutorial (maybe after a header and before a footer):
<div class="tutorialjs"></div>
Now add a script to start the tutorial. Add this before the </body> tag: 
<script>
   var mytutorial = new Tutorial("first_step.json");
   mytutorial.start();
</script>
You can also launch tutorial.js with an event, for instance with window.onload = mytutorial.start;.

Note: Remember to place the JSON files on the same directory of your HTML page. Otherwise, you'll need to use the path parameter on tutorial.js to indicate the path of all files.

Note: If you use the default CSS file, pictures will be shown on the right side. Add tutorialjs-left to the class attribute if you want them to appear on the left.
